Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Landmark-Guided and Ultrasound-Guided Intra-Articular Analgesic Injections for Shoulder Dislocation Reduction

Trial_Design.evidence: Twenty-eight patients with anterior shoulder dislocation were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: Twenty-eight patients with anterior shoulder dislocation were randomly assigned to either the landmark-guided or ultrasound-guided intra-articular lidocaine injection group.

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to either the landmark-guided or ultrasound-guided intra-articular lidocaine injection group

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare the efficacy of landmark-guided versus ultrasound-guided intra-articular analgesic injections.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain reduction, assessed using the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) before and after injection, and before injection and after reduction.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to patients or clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fourteen patients were randomised to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Fourteen patients were randomised to each group.

Harms.evidence: No complications were reported in either group during the 2-week follow-up.
